speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the lesions on your skin? When did you first notice them and have they changed in size, shape, or color over time?

speaker: Patient
text: Doc, I first noticed the lesions about two weeks ago, and they've just kept getting bigger and more painful. The crusty part is really itchy, and the red part is really tender to the touch.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you show me exactly where these lesions are located on your body, and how many of them you have in total?

speaker: Patient
text: Doc, the lesion on my penis is about the size of a pea, and it's located on the shaft, just above the head. There's also a similar one on my left middle finger, about an inch long.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the crusty part that's itchy? Is it oozing or has it broken down in any way, and have you noticed any discharge or unusual odor from the lesion?

speaker: Patient
text: The crusty part is really flaky and it's breaking off in pieces. It's been oozing a bit, but not a lot, just a small amount of clear liquid that's been coming out for the past few days. I haven't really noticed any unusual smell, but it does have a bit of a sour taste when I lick it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the pain you're experiencing? Is it constant, or does it come and go, and is it more painful when you press on the lesions or move your fingers? Also, have you noticed any fever or chills, or any other symptoms like swollen lymph nodes or fatigue?

speaker: Patient
text: Doc, the pain is constant, it's always there, but it does get a bit worse when I press on the lesions or move my fingers. And yeah, I have to admit, I've been feeling a bit tired lately, especially after a long day of work.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm going to take a closer look at these lesions. (examines the lesions) Hmm, I notice that the lesions on your penis and finger are both quite red and inflamed, and the crusty part is breaking off in pieces. That's concerning. Can you tell me more about the lesions on your penis? Have you noticed any bleeding, or has the crusty part been oozing blood at all? Also, REQUEST TEST: Blood Work. I'd like to check your complete blood count and liver function to see if there are any abnormal levels that could be related to your symptoms.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: - Vital Signs: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98.2°F) - Blood Pressure: 130/85 mmHg - Heart Rate: 82 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 14 breaths/min - Dermatological Examination: - Inspection: An erythematous plaque with areas of crusting, oozing, and irregular borders observed on the dorsal surface of the penile shaft and on the left middle finger. - Palpation: Lesions are firm to touch, non-tender, with no warmth. - Regional Lymph Nodes: No palpable cervical, axillary, or inguinal lymphadenopathy. - tests: - Biopsy: - Findings: Cells with nuclear hyperchromasia, multinucleation, and increased mitotic figures within the follicle-bearing epithelium. - STD_Panel: - Syphilis: Negative - HIV: Negative - HBV: Negative - HCV: Negative

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask a few more questions to help narrow down the possibilities. Can you tell me more about the pain you're experiencing? speaker: Patient

And yeah, I have been having some trouble with my bowel movements lately, I've been having some loose stools and I've been feeling a bit bloated.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your bowel movements? Are the loose stools watery or more like diarrhea, and have you noticed any blood in the stool or mucus? And one more thing, have you recently changed any personal care products, such as soaps or lotions, that could be irritating your skin?

speaker: Patient
text: Doc, the loose stools are more like diarrhea, and I have noticed a bit of mucus in them, but no blood. As for the finger, I've noticed that the skin around the lesion is a bit swollen and red, and there's a small amount of pus that's been forming around the edge of the lesion.

speaker: Doctor
